message.content:
{"id": "108822", 
"title": "More logical disk sorting expected when there is a border value for row value", 
"description": "The current logic for disk sorting seems to be inefficient when sorting a large dataset of 40000 rows. The program is set to process a subset of the data that is less than 40000. The current operation is as follows: ", 
"OB": "When sorting on disk, if the program is set to process only a subset of the data that is less than 40000 rows, the current logic for disk sorting is not efficient.", 
"EB": "A more efficient logic for disk sorting is expected when there is a border value for the row value, especially when sorting a large dataset of 40000 rows.", 
"SR": "Revise the logic for disk sorting to improve its efficiency, especially when handling a large dataset with a border value for the row value."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
